title: bugatti_chiron
body:
A [[sports_car|hypercar]] produced by French boutique manufacturer [[Bugatti]], introduced as a successor of the [[Bugatti Veyron]]. Renowned for its extremely luxurious interior and 16-cylinder engine.

The Super Sport version is currently the fastest production car in the world, having reached a top speed of 490 km/h. This has not been accomplished under Guinness standards, however, so it only .

title: ikaruga_(senran_kagura)
body:
[[Senran Kagura]] character. A third-year Shinobi at the Hanzou Academy. She is the oldest in the group.

Ikaruga has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and flat [[bangs]]. She wears the regular [[school uniform]] for Hanzou Academy. When she transforms into a Shinobi, she wears a white, gold-trimmed [[jacket]] with six buttons. She wears an [[armband]] on her left arm for Hanzou Academy. She also has a white, gold-trimmed [[skirt]] and [[boots]], with [[black pantyhose]] underneath.

When her uniform has been ripped off, she wears a [[black bikini]].

Her seiyuu is [[Imai Asami]].

title: cathyl
body:
A [[Monster Musume no Iru Nichijou]] character. Cathyl is a [[cow girl|female minotaur]].

Cathyl is a very [[tall female|tall]] (231cm / 7'7") and [[muscular female|muscular woman]], with [[huge breasts]] (Q-cup) that [[breast expansion|grow]] even [[gigantic breasts|larger]] when full. Her B-W-H measurements are 171(Q)-79-130. 
She has [[brown eyes]] with [[horizontal pupils]]. She keeps her [[two-tone hair]] (dark [[brown hair|brown]] and [[white hair|white]]) in a [[ponytail]] with [[striped hair|stripes]] going down the length of it. She has a thick dark brown [[facial mark|stripe under each of her eyes]].

As a Minotaur, she has a pair of large upward-facing [[cow horns]] on her head, [[cow ears]], [[cow tail]], and a [[animal legs|cow legs]] (starting from [[knees]]) which are covered with fur and have [[hooves]] instead of feet.

Her clothing consists of nothing but [[torn overalls|ripped]] [[blue overalls]] with a relatively small [[cow print]]ed [[bikini|trikini]] top underneath (although in the recent chapters the bikini was absent or missing) and a pair of [[work gloves]]. She also wears a [[cowbell]] around her neck.

She used to work as a farm hand on a Black Lily Ranch doing lots of heavy lifting and power work. She is in a relationship with the ranch's owner, and later transferred to the Black Lily Ranch to share her expertise. She is frequently seen with her friend [[Merino (monster musume)|]].

h4. External links
* "Monster Musume Wiki: Cathyl":[https://dailylifewithamonstergirl.fandom.com/wiki/Cathyl]

title: lantern_on_liquid
body:
[[Lantern]] floating in water.

They're often seen in "Ghost Festival":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghost_Festival] (Chinese Zhongyuan Jie or Japanese "Obon":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bon_Festival]) and some "Lantern festivals":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lantern_Festival] such as Thailand "Loi Krathong":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loi_Krathong]. In both Taoists and Buddhists, releasing lanterns on water is known as a ritual to transmute and absolve the sufferings of the deceased.

h4. See also
* [[sanzu river]]
* [[sky lantern]]

title: anaconda_vice
body:
A [[submission hold]] innovated by [[New Japan Pro Wrestling|NJPW]] wrestler Tenzan Hiroyoshi and also used by [[All Elite Wrestling]] alumnus and current [[WWE]] wrestler [[CM Punk]].

The Anaconda Vice is done from a position in which the wrestler and the opponent are seated on the mat facing each other. The wrestler sits on one side of the opponent and using his near arm encircles the opponent in a headlock position and grabs the opponent's near wrist, bending the arm upwards. Then, the wrestler maneuvers his/her other arm through the "hole" created by the opponent's bent wrist, locks his/her hand upon his/her own wrist, and then pulls the opponent forward, causing pressure on the opponent's arm and neck.

It can also be spelled as [b]Anaconda Vise[/b] and its technical name is [i]Arm-Trap Triangle Choke[/i].

title: suika_game
body:
A puzzle game developed by AladdinX where you merge fruits to create a [[watermelon]] ([i]suika[/i] in Japanese). Similar to the game "2048". The player drops a random fruit into a box. Fruits of the same type will merge into a different larger fruit, with the largest fruit being a watermelon. The game ends if the fruits overflow the box.

You start with the [[Cherry]] as the smallest fruit, then later on [[Strawberry]], [[Grapes]], [[Dekopon (fruit)|]], [[Persimmon]]s, [[Apple]]s, [[Nashi Pear|Pear]]s, [[Peach]]es, [[Pineapple]], [[Melon]]/[[Cantaloupe]], and finally, Watermelon.

The game has gained sudden popularity after it was played by various Japanese [[virtual YouTuber]]s, though controversy after the developers forbade the clipping of the gameplay footage by third parties later caused the VTubers to switch to fan games/clones instead. The ban has since been lifted.

h4. External links

* "Official page":https://www.aladdinx.jp/pages/suika-game (Japanese)
* "Product page on Nintendo website":https://www.nintendo.com/us/store/products/suika-game-switch/
* "Wikipedia: Suika Game":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suika_Game

title: loser_gesture
body: The Loser Gesture is a {{hand_gesture|hand gesture}} made by extending the right thumb and {{index_finger_raised|index fingers}}, leaving the other fingers closed to create the letter L, interpreted as "loser", and generally given as a demeaning sign. Sometimes this is accompanied by raising the {{hand_on_own_forehead|hand to the giver's forehead}}.

title: mazinger_z
body:
[i][b]Mazinger Z[/b][/i] (マジンガーZ [i]Majingā Zetto[/i]) is a classic and extremely influential and popular giant [[super robot]] manga that ran in [i]Weekly Shonen Jump[/i] from 1972 until 1973. The series was created by [[Nagai Gou]] (Kiyoshi Nagai).

The story tells the adventures of [[Kabuto Kouji]], the young brave pilot of Mazinger Z, a powerful [[mecha]] with super powers that fights against evil hostile giant [[robot]]s called "mechanical [[monster|beasts]]".

Due to its popularity the original manga was turned into a 92 episode anime that debuted also in late 1972 and ended in 1974. It has spawned several notable sequels and spinoff series, among them [[UFO Robo Grendizer]], [[Mazinkaiser]], and [[Robot Girls Z]].

Mazinger Z was broadcast in several countries and became very famous worldwide. Its fame in some European countries was such that even "a giant statue of the titular robot":http://trip-n-travel.com/listicle/16496/ was erected in the province of Tarragona, [[Spain]], in the year 1979. 

It was also a very popular anime in [[Mexico]] during the 1980s, where it was dubbed into [[spanish_text|Spanish]] directly from the Japanese version, keeping all the original Japanese character names intact and broadcasting all the complete 92 episodes, unlike the version later aired in the [[united_states|U.S.]] (which was called [i][b]Tranzor Z[/b][/i] and was not very popular due to its severe censorship and many absent episodes).

Mexican director [[Guillermo del Toro]] has cited this show as a very important influence on his movie [[Pacific Rim]]. The comic [[Karmatron y los Transformables]] was also heavily influenced by Mazinger.

This tag should be used for the original manga/anime and related media. For the franchise as a whole use [[Mazinger (series)]].

title: koizumi_itsuki
body:
Character from [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu]]. A lighthearted esper who works with an organization of peers. His powers pertain to dealing with 'closed spaces' that appear due to [[Suzumiya Haruhi]]'s negative emotions. He is a popular target for yaoi fans, due to his [[fabulous]]ness, carefree smiling demeanor, and questionable actions towards [[Kyon]] (particularly in the anime). [spoiler]In the novels he reveals he has feelings for Haruhi, though fans often paired him with [[Nagato Yuki]] instead.[/spoiler]

title: indian_elephant
body:
The Indian elephant ([i]Elephas maximus indicus[/i]) is one of three extant recognized subspecies of the Asian [[elephant]] and native to mainland Asia.

In general, Asian elephants are smaller than [[African elephant|African elephants]] and have smaller ears, but relatively broader skulls and larger trunks than African elephants.

Notably, one of these elephants were mentioned in [[Pokedex]] entries for [[Raichu]] and [[Gastly]], despite the near-total absence of real life animals in [[Pokemon]].

title: laser_sight
body:
A detachable, rectangular laser module mounted to a firearm which projects a colored beam onto the target, improving the shooter's accuracy. Also see [[laser pointer projection]], which can be used when the beam and/or dot are visible. 

Not to be confused with [[laser pointer]], a small cylindrical tool used to direct attention to one spot during meetings and lectures.

Also please don't confuse with [[eye beam]], where lasers may shoot from a character's eyes.

title: gatsha_(mobile_suit)
body:
[b]MS-13 Gatsha[/b]

Also known as the [b]Gasshia[/b], it is a compact [[Zeon]] [[mobile suit]] originally created as an amphibious unit and later developed as a close quarters [[space]] attack mecha. It is armed with dual [[missile pod]]s, [[claws]] and a powerful short-ranged [[spiked mace]] launcher gun (called the "Hammer Gun").

It somewhat resembles the [[spartan_(destroid)|Spartan]] [[Destroid]] mecha from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]].

title: belphemon
body:
A Demon Lord Digimon. Belphemon has two forms: [[belphemon sleep mode|Sleep Mode]], in which it resembles a [[chibi]] bat-like creature with horns on its head, an [[uwu]] face and chains restraining it locked in place by an alarm clock, and [[belphemon rage mode|Rage Mode]], where it takes the form of a huge, muscular, clawed monster with the chains ruptured and multiple wings on its back. As a member of the Seven Great Demon Lords, it represents the sin of Sloth, and has the title "Roar of Awakening" (目覚めの咆哮, [i]Mezame no Houkou[/i]). 

For the purposes of this tag, both forms of Belphemon will be treated as one and the same.

title: shiran_no_ka_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from a scene in [[Space Adventure Cobra]]. It involves a character anticipating something happening, another character asking what will happen afterwards, and receiving an ironic response from the first, punctuated by 知らんのか ("You don't know?"). The meme received a lot of attention in social game circles under the format:

"What happens when maintenance ends?"
"You don't know?"
"That's when maintenance begins."

title: genesis_breaker
body:
An official 2022 side story project set in the [[Mospeada]] [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] anime universe.

Produced by [[Tatsunoko Pro]]duction,  [b][i]Genesis Climber Mospeada: Genesis Breaker[/i][/b] is a side story set in the original [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]] TV series timeline. 

[[Aramaki Shinji]] and [[Kakinuma Hideki]] ([[Bubblegum Crisis]], [[Armitage III]], [[Gall Force]], [[Junk Force]]), main staff of the original [[1980s_(style)|80s]] series, are returning as mechanical designers for the new project.

Genesis Breaker will start serializing in [[Hobby JAPAN]] magazine in August 2022 with a story written by Kakinuma that is parallel to the events of the original series.

In accordance with the launch of the new project, Tokyo-based toy/figure manufacturer Sentinel company plans to release a 1/12 action figure of a new [[ride armor]] design for the series. 

h4. Main characters

* [[Gate (Mospeada)]]

title: gatling_033
body:
Gatling 033 (ガトリング033, Gatoringu 033), also known by the codenames Rush (ラッシュ, Rasshu) and Henrietta (アンリエッタ, Anrietta), is a Second Generation Object of the Information Alliance's Sky Dog(br) 3rd C.E.B, piloted by the Elite commonly referred to as "Oh ho ho".

The Gatling 033 is made up of a spherical main body with a cross-shaped float and treads located directly below that. The floats extend to the front, back, left, and right. The two to the left and the right each have a rapid fire beam cannon Gatling gun installed on the top of the end.

It has over 100 cannons, both large and small, but it does not have all that many on the side. It has almost 20 smaller cannons on each side. This is likely to give priority to the main cannons.

The cockpit is a sphere of about 2 meters across with a giant monitor attached to the front. A large number of keyboards are lined up on three stepped levels. The third step spreads out in a U-shape around the edge of the cockpit. In the space not taken up by keyboards, an inscription reads “Manual Interface ‘JULIET’.

title: tatehiza
body: In Japanese, tate-hiza (立膝), meaning "standing knee," is a way to sit on the floor: with one knee up. It is a blend of [[crossed_legs|sitting crossed-legged]], with the leg in proximity of touching the other thigh; and the other leg [[knees_up|kneeling up]], where the person either puts the [[hands_on_own_knees]], or can [[leaning_back|lean back]] and use either one or both of their arms for [[arm_support]]. Example being "the tarnished one":[/posts/6910237].

title: malenia_blade_of_miquella
body:
A character in [[Elden Ring]]. She is the [[twins|twin]] [[brother and sister|sister]] and loyal follower of [[Miquella (elden ring)|]], and the [[family|daughter]] of [[radagon of the golden order|Radagon]] and [[queen marika the eternal|Marika]].

Called The Undefeated Swordswoman, she wears [[gold armor|golden armor]] with a stylized [[winged helmet]], resembling [[fine art|classical]] depictions of [[valkyrie]]. Her [[prosthetic arm|right arm]] and both of her [[prosthetic leg|leg]]s are [[prosthesis|prosthetic]]. The left leg is attached just below the hip, while the right one attaches a little below the knee. Her arm is attached at the shoulder and has a fold-out [[katana]] blade built into it.

Her [[triple amputee|missing limbs]] and [[scar]]s are a result of the Scarlet Rot, a terrifying disease that she is the vessel for, rather than [[injury|injuries]] from combat.

[spoilers] Upon defeating Malenia, she calls out to the [[tarnished (elden ring)|Tarnished]] to wait before getting back up as [[malenia goddess of rot|Malenia, Goddess of Rot]] to continue fighting.[/spoilers]

h4. See also

* [[let me solo her]]

title: houshou_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodels/kai ni of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Houshou (Kancolle)|]], as seen in post #5878341 for standard kai ni and post #5878299 for E version.

Released 06 December 2022, her kai ni comes in two forms: standard kai ni and a transport "E" version. She keeps her usual [[Japanese clothes|traditional outfit]] from base form in her standard kai ni but gains a white [[hair ribbon]], large white [[sash]] ([i]these two are the most obvious changes to note if she's not depicted with her rig or in her E version[/i]), and a 28 cm [[anti-aircraft gun|rocket launcher]] on her [[quiver]], while her [[flight deck]] gains a catapult (faintly seen). 

Her "E" version swaps her base outfit in favor of a [[green kimono]] meant to represent her real-life camouflage pattern, while she holds a daihatsu amphibious landing craft.

In remodeling Houshou from kai to kai ni, a prototype catapult is required as she never received any upgrade after 1944 (when she was modified to handle heavier aircraft for training purposes), and never received any aircraft catapult.

title: tama_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel/kai ni of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Tama (Kancolle)|]], as seen in post #2951522 and released on December 2017. 

She now wears a [[serafuku]] composed of a white short-sleeved sailor shirt with [[black sailor collar]] and black tiger stripe-like pattern (a reference to her historical Aleutian Islands operations alongside Kiso), a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]], [[black gloves]], and [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thigh boots]] with pawlike-toe tips and the right boot having white tiger stripes.

h4. [i]Kuma[/i]-class light cruisers (kai ni)
* [[Kuma Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kuma]]
* [b]Tama[/b]
* [[Kiso Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kiso]]

title: kuma_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel/kai ni of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Kuma (Kancolle)|]], as seen in post #4301299 and post #4301281, released on January 13, 2021.

Rather ironic for a lead ship, Kuma was last of her class to be given her official second remodels, Kai-Ni and Kai-Ni-Tei (D). 

h5. Standard
Kai-Ni (post #4301299) has her wear a stylized [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[sailor shirt|sailor blouse]] with a [[green sailor collar]], a red [[ribbon|neck ribbon]], [[white skirt|white]] [[culottes]] (essentially a [[pleated skirt]] with a divided section), and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]] as well as upgraded machinery. 

h5. Tei
Her Kai-Ni-Tei form (post #4301281) changes the color scheme of her serafuku to an [[orange shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]] and [[black skirt|black]] [[culottes]]. This form also trades the ability to equip seaplanes and torpedoes with carrying midget submariness and daihatsu. She was sometimes grouped with Tenryuu and Shiratsuyu as having sisters who received second remodels before being remodeled themselves.

h4. [i]Kuma[/i]-class light cruisers (kai ni)

title: turkey_(country)
body:
The Republic of Turkey is a country located at the crossroads between Europe and Asia, largely based in Asia Minor. Born a secular country out of the ashes of the [[Ottoman Empire]], and technically still so. The people there are not Arabic, but Turkish.

In May 2022 the Turkish government requested to the UN to formally change their official English name to the Republic of Türkiye to better reflect their heritage and avoid association with the [[Turkey (bird)|bird]], or as critics suggest it's to avoid the association of the other meaning for the word turkey in English.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Turkey":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey]

title: bomb_suit
body:
A type of modern [[body armor]] designed to protect their users (commonly Bomb Squad officers and military personel) while they are carrying out their duties such as bomb defusing and removal, against the overpressure and fragments caused by accidental detonations.

Bulky in appearance, they cover the entire body, even covering the sides of the head. Most curiously, they don't offer any kind of protection to the hands, because it is necessary for its user to remain precise (Something that the use of gloves wouldn't permit).

h4. External links

* "Bomb suit":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bomb_suit at wikipedia

title: damiwi

title: blood_bag
body:
A small bag full of [[blood]], which has been collected from the patient or from a blood donor in order to replace that patient's blood should there be a lot of blood loss during surgery, or from exsanguination due to a critical [[injury]].

Different patients/donors' blood is collected, analyzed and grouped according to blood type, of which there are four: "A, B, AB, and O":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_blood_group_systems, depending upon inherited antigens. There is also the + and - status to indicate if the "Rh factor":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rh_blood_group_system (or Rhesus factor) is present.

Blood bags are often seen hanging from [[iv stand|intravenous stands]] in hospitals near the patient's bed.

title: geoduck
body:
A type of saltwater [[clam]] native to the west coast of North America.

The shell of the clam ranges from 15 centimeters (5.9 in) to over 20 centimeters (7.9 in) in length, but the extremely long siphons make the clam itself much longer than this, with the siphons alone being able to reach 1 meter (3.3 ft) in length. The geoduck is one of the largest clams in the world and one of the longest-lived animals in the world, with the oldest known specimen having lived 168 years.

Rather infamous for its [[phallic_symbol|phallic]] shape, which led into it became a delicacy and are believed to have aphodisaic properties.

h4. External links 

* "Wikipedia: Geoduck":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geoduck

title: t-80
body:
The [b]T-80[/b] is a third-generation [[tank|main battle tank]], designed and manufactured in the [[soviet|Soviet Union]]. It was based on the [[T-64]], while incorporating features from the later [[T-72]] and transitioning from a diesel to a gas turbine engine. When it entered service in 1976, it was the first production [[military vehicle|tank]] to be powered solely by turbine.

This tag applies to all T-80 variants, such as T-80U(D), Black Eagle prototype, and more.

h4. See also
* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: T-80":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T-80

title: life_fiber
body:
In [[Kill la Kill]], Life Fibers are an organic cells of extraterraestial origin woven into clothing, which enhances its wearer's abilities to a superhuman degree: They can bestow superhuman strength, speed, agility, resistance to injury, awareness and other superpowers.

One class of such clothing is called "Goku Uniforms" and is divided into three categories based on how much Life Fibers they have woven into them; the more Life Fibers a Goku Uniform contains, the more powerful the wearer becomes at the risk of being overwhelmed, killed and/or consumed by the Life Fibers. A One-Star Goku Uniform has 10% Life Fibers, a Two-Star has 20%, a Three-Star has (most likely) 30%, etc. Clothes made entirely made of Life Fibers are called Kamui and are, at least in [[Senketsu]]'s case, sentient.

Her tail often sports a [[tail bow]], and she is often depicted in [[thighhighs]] and a [[frilled dress]], [[frilled bikini]], or a [[frilled babydoll]] / other [[lingerie]] with [[frilled panties]].

title: monopoly
body:
A [[board game]] whose object is to purchase and develop real estate properties in order to drive your opponents into bankruptcy.

Despite its perennial popularity, the game is infamous for its length, complexity (for a mainstream board game), and its tendency to make losing players [[ragequit]] in frustration.

title: cryamore
body:
[b]Cryamore[/b] was a video game by [i]NostalgiCO[/i] / lead artist [[Robaato]].

[quote]
From Cryamore Development Blog:

[b]Cryamore[/b] was an upcoming Indie action-adventure/RPG hybrid, inspired in art style and gameplay by games like [[The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past]], [[Mega Man (series)|]], and [[Seiken Densetsu|Secret of Mana]].
[/quote]

The game was to be released on [[Microsoft Windows]], Mac OS, Linux, iOS, and [[Android (os)|]]. Since the Kickstarter project raised $242,309 (of its $60,000 goal), thus completing all its stretch goals, the game was also supposed to release for [[PlayStation 3]], [[Wii U]] and [[Xbox 360]] consoles.

As of 2021, it is considered vaporware.

h4. Characters

* [[Esmyrelda Maximus]]
* [[Bliss Barson]]

title: enigma_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character
Designed by [[musou_luf|MusouLuf]]

A cryptographic life form born into a space beyond the bounds of the 23 other worlds. He was deciphered by the Guild Master of the Akihabara Creators and given an outer appearance and personality for interacting with the world at large. Specifically, in accordance with the preferences of the one he calls his creator, he's taken on the form of a mechanical Therian. His true form is immaterial, however, as Enigma's existence is comprised solely of data transmitted over the net. The upshot of this is that he's capable of self-reproducing with no limits beyond those of his own available resources, and each and every copy is individually customized and optimized for the service of a specific end user. This particular Enigma has been customized for use by the Guild Master of the Summoners, considering himself to be something of a secretary for his assigned master and adopting a vaguely condescending, highly intellectual persona in service to that end. The idea, it seems, is that he quite genuinely wishes to supplement the shortcomings of his master's ego, as calculated through careful observation and data-crunching, in order to prove his worth. This is very much in keeping with his self-proclaimed role, since the very word secretary is derived from secret, having long ago been used to refer to those who safeguarded the classified documents of the aristocracy—a term which perfectly and succinctly fits the identity of this cryptographic Enigma like a glove. There is one particular Transient who's quite taken with Enigma, being extremely fond of puzzles and quizzes.

h4. External Links

* "Housamo Wiki: Enigma":[https://housamo.wiki/Enigma]

title: amduscias_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character
Designed by [[arashi_takemoto|Arashi Takemoto]]

Transient from the world of Gehenna, a world said to lie deep within the earth. He's a demon known make beautiful music play from somewhere else than his position when he appears. Since coming to Tokyo he's been busy making Vocaloids sing original songs. Back then when he was working while refusing to show his face he went by the name AmP, and even now the videos from then are floating around the deep web with tons of comments. After seeing an idol's live concert, Amduscias starting dreaming of singing as an idol himself. What if he started singing and dancing cutely with music that makes you want to shake your body? But since Amduscias thought his large frame was unshapely, he kept his wish close to his heart. Amduscias has regularly hid that part of himself from others with rugged fashion, but after meeting someone calling themselves his first fan he's taken a step towards fulfilling his dream. It's time he started climbing the road towards being Tokyo's top therian idol with his gorgeous outfit and signature pose! Lately you can find him at underground idol stages making obscure appearances. If you go and order the signed shirts or little instant cameras he's selling there, his eyes will shine in delight. He's getting impassioned coaching from a senpai that knows the harshness of the entertainment business and sees him as a diamond in the rough. Amduscias highly respects this senpai and is working hard to be good enough to stand on stage with him. 

h4. External Links

* "Housamo Wiki: Amduscias":[https://housamo.wiki/Amduscias]

title: pluto_(manga)
body:
[b]PLUTO[/b] (プルートウ, [i]Purūtō[/i])  is a Japanese [[science fiction]], [[cyberpunk]] and detective manga series written and illustrated by [[Urasawa Naoki]] (of [[MONSTER (manga)|]] fame). 

It was serialized in Shogakukan's seinen manga magazine Big Comic Original from September 2003 to April 2009, with its chapters collected into eight tankōbon volumes. The series is based on the [[Tezuka Osamu]]'s [[Tetsuwan Atom]]/[[atom (pluto)|Astro Boy]] classic manga series, specifically a reboot of "The Greatest Robot on Earth" (地上最大のロボット, [i]Chijō Saidai no Robotto[/i]) story arc, and named after [[pluto (pluto (manga))|the arc's chief villain]]. 

Urasawa reinterprets the story as a suspenseful murder mystery starring [[Gesicht (pluto)|]], a Europol robot detective trying to solve the case of a string of [[robot]] and human deaths. 

Nagasaki Takashi is credited as the series' co-author. Tezuka Macoto, Tezuka Osamu's son, supervised the series, and Tezuka Productions is listed as having given cooperation. The series was licensed and released in English in North America by Viz Media under the name [b]PLUTO: Urasawa x Tezuka[/b]. 

PLUTO was a critical and commercial success, winning several awards, including the ninth Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize, and selling over 8.5 million copies. An original net anime series, produced by Genco and Tezuka Productions, and animated by Studio M2, premiered on [[Netflix]] in 2023.

h4.Other characters

* [[Mont Blanc (pluto)|]]
* [[Brau 1589]]
* [[North No. 2 (pluto)|]]
* [[Brando (pluto)|]] 
* [[Hercules (pluto)|]] 
* [[Epsilon (pluto)|]]  

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pluto_(manga)

title: popola
body:
A recurring character from [[Nier (series)|]], the [[twins|twin]] [[sisters|sister]] of [[Devola]], distinguishable by her [[straight hair]] and serious personality. She is voiced by [[Shiraishi Ryouko]] (JP) and Eden Riegel (EN), original character design was done by [[D.K]].

h5. Appearance
Popola has [[green eyes]], [[medium hair|medium length]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[red hair]] .

h5. Apparel (Gestalt/RepliCant)
Popola's Gestalt/RepliCant outfit consist of a [[red shirt|red]] [[strapless shirt]] top with a [[baggy pants|baggy]] [[red pants]] with [[cross-laced pants|crosslaced]] sides. Wears a [[white tabard]] over the outfit. Sometimes depicted with a [[wand]].

h5. Apparel (Automata)
Her Automata appearance has a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress]] with [[fishnet cutout|fishnet]] [[shoulder cutout]]s and a [[side slit]] on the right, wears a pair of [[red pants]], [[knee pads]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]] on the lower body.

title: fancy_island
body:
[b]lomando.com[/b], also called "[b]Fancy Island[/b]", is a point-and-click Japanese horror puzzle browser 'game', infamous for its deceptive front page, which is disguised with cute aesthetics and illustrations themed around a [[cat girl]] character. 

The game is initiated by clicking on an image of the site '[[mimi_(fancy_island)|mascot]]'. The objective is to navigate through the various 'levels', attempting to avoid countless [[jumpscare|screamers]]/monsters along the way, and defeat the 'final boss' at the end.


h4. External links

* "Article on Screamer Wiki":https://screamer.fandom.com/wiki/Lomando.com

title: g-arcane
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Gundam G No Reconguista]] series from 2014.

[b]MSAM-033 Gundam G-Arcane[/b]

A prototype high performance [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by the Amerian Army. 

While the design could not compete with the [[G-Self]] due to a difference in technological expertise from the Amerians, it was nonetheless a very capable unit, usually equipped with a powerful long range [[beam rifle]] for accurate sniping. It was piloted by [[Aida Rayhunton|Aida Surugan]]. While on the Venus Globe, the unit is equipped with the Full Dress specification with additional skirt beam cannons, enabling it to become an omnidirectional force on the battlefield.

title: g-self
body:
The main protagonist [[Gundam]] [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam G no Reconguista]] anime [[science fiction]] TV series from 2014. It was designed by [[Yasuda Akira]].

The [b]YG-111 Gundam G-Self[/b] is a very powerful and very advanced prototype general purpose [[mobile suit]]. It can be equipped with several different types of combat and power packs depending on its use and also has a [[core fighter]] as its central cockpit block.

title: orange_planet_uniform
body:
The [[uniform]] worn by [[undine (aria)|Undines]] from the Orange Planet Company in [i][[ARIA (manga)|]][/i]. I has 2 different variations depending on the season:

The [[summer uniform|summer]] version consists of a yellow-trimmed, [[sailor collar|sailor-collared]], [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], worn over a [[long dress|long]], [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]]. The blouse is rather short, reaching only below the breasts and features a [[patch]] with the company [[logo]] on the left sleeve and yellow [[chevron (symbol)|]] on the other one.

The [[winter uniform|winter version]] replaces the blouse with a [[white capelet]] with yellow or [[gold trim|golden trims]] and a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]], [[high collar|high-collared]] [[white dress]], a long-sleeved [[white shirt|white]] [[undershirt]] and [[purple pantyhose]].

The dress in both versions has yellow trims and prominently features the company [[logo]] in yellow on both the front and the back, and is surprisingly [[skin tight]], almost to the point of being an [[impossible dress]] and has a cutout either on the front or the [[side slit|side]] of one of the legs.

Both versions feature [[yellow footwear|white]] [[knee boots]], a [[yellow ascot]] and a [[white headwear|white]] [[beret]] with the company logo on the front.

h4. See also
* [[Aria Company uniform]]
* [[Himeya Company uniform]]
* [[List of uniforms]]

title: king_ghidorah_(monsterverse)
body:
[b]From the Hydra to the Rainbow Serpent, myth was the compass that led us to the resting place of the three-headed Titan. A name, unspoken through millennia of whispered nightmares. A living extinction event, named “the one who is many”. We call it Monster Zero.[/b]
— Monarch Sciences description

The [[King Ghidorah]] (キングギドラ Kingu Gidora) of the [[MonsterVerse]], also dubbed Monster Zero, is a daikaiju appeared in 2019 film, [[Godzilla: King of the Monsters]]. Notable for how each of its head had its own personalities as opposed to original "shared brain" Ghidorah.

title: rodan_(monsterverse)
body:
[b]Within a Monarch containment facility atop the active Isla de Mona volcano, a mysterious Titan lies in pyrostasis within the restless magma. The legends speak of it as the “Fire Demon” or “The One Born of Fire”, but a simpler name echoes through the ancient temples of volcanically active regions: “[[Rodan]]”.[/b]	„ 
— Monarch Sciences description

title: mothra_(monsterverse)
body:
[b]From erased Nazca lines to the hidden Temple of the Moth, the name “[[Mothra]]” is woven throughout the most secret mythologies of our planet. The folklore and fairy tales tell of a winged creature of blinding light, an angel of the clouds whose god-like luminescence has the power to shatter the sky.[/b]
— Monarch Sciences description

title: gondola
body:
A traditional passenger-carrying [[boat]] of Venice, Italy, measuring a law-regulated 10.85m in length and having an maximum breadth of 1.40m. It is often sculled by a single person standing on the rear deck, with the [[oar]] resting on an oarlock. Gondolas with multiple rowers also exist, an example being the [i]traghetto[/i] or ferry gondola. 

[i]Gondole[/i] can be differentiated from other boats by being asymmetrical, with one side being slightly longer than the other, and by the presence of a [i]ferro[/i], a stylized S-shaped bow ornament made of metal whose design represents elements of Venice and whose weight counterbalances that of the gondolier.

Gondolas figure prominently in [[Amano Kozue]]'s anime and manga series [[Aria (manga)|]].

h4. See also

* [[rowboat]]
* [[ship]]

The mentor of [[Alice Carroll]] and the tallest of the six main [i]undine[/i] characters in Aria. She has [[short hair]] which is usually depicted as [[white hair|white]] or a light shade of [[grey hair|grey]] or [[purple hair|purple]]. She is a gifted singer and is often absent-minded.

title: alice_carroll
body:
A gondolier-in-training for the Orange Planet company in the [[Aria (manga)|]] manga and anime series, Alice is a quiet, aloof prodigy with who forms part of the central trio of characters, along with [[Mizunashi Akari]] and [[Aika Granzchesta]]. Her Prima mentor is [[Athena Glory]], and she takes care of [[President Maa]], whom she found and kept.

Alice has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[green hair]] with [[bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes| between her eyes]], which she often keeps keeps in a [[two side up]] outside of work. She is often depicted wearing the [[Orange Planet uniform]] or her [[school uniform]]. In Avvenire she appears [[aged up]] and has [[wavy hair|wavy]] or [[curly hair]] with [[sidelocks]].

She is voiced by "Hirohashi Ryou":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/people.php?id=8851.

title: amano_kozue
body: creator of [[Aria (manga)|]] and [[amanchu!]]

title: alicia_florence
body:
One of the Three Water Fairies in [[Amano Kozue]]'s [[Aria (manga)|]], along with [[Akira Ferrari]] and [[Athena Glory]]. At the start of the story, Alicia is the sole professional gondolier of a small company offering guided tours of the city of Neo-Venezia on the planet Aqua. She becomes [[Mizunashi Akari]]'s mentor when the latter joins Aria Company. 

Alicia's chief physical characteristics are her [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]] and smile. Two long [[sidelocks]] often flank her face. When in uniform, she keeps her hair in its signature [[single braid]]; her off-duty hairstyle varies (young Alicia has braided [[twintails]]). As a Prima [i]undine[/i], she does not wear gloves. She sometimes wears [[glasses]]. She is also associated with "[[ara ara]] (あらあら)" and "ufufu (うふふ)," these being her trademark utterances.
other_names: アリシア・フローレンス

title: aika_granzchesta
body:
A main character in [[Aria (manga)|]]. A Himeya Company gondolier-in-training.

She has [[yellow eyes]] and dark [[blue hair]] with, which in the beginning of the series was gathered into [[long hair]], thin [[twin braids]] and [[swept bangs]], later changing into a [[bob cut]] fastened by [[hairclip|hairclips]] after Aika's hair was burned during a barbeque mishap. By the time of Avvenire she has grown her hair into [[short hair with long locks|short hair and long]] [[sidelocks]], still featuring the hairclips and the swept bangs. She is often depicted wearing the [[Himeya company  uniform]]

Aika takes care of the Himeya mascot, [[Hime Granzchesta]], and tries to keep fellow trainees [[Mizunashi Akari]] and [[Alice Carroll]] on an even keel. Her catchphrase is "恥ずかしいセリフ禁止!" (Saying embarrassing things is prohibited!)

body:
[b]Aldra[/b] (アルドラ) is a [[Queen's Blade]] character. Voiced by Takeuchi Miyu and [[Taketatsu Ayana]], designed by [[Kantaka]]. She is the reigning "Queen" (i.e. champion) of the Queen's Blade tournament. She is [[Annelotte (queen's blade)|]]'s older sister, albeit corrupted into a half-demon after forming a pact with them in exchange for power.

She has long [[grey hair]] and [[red eyes]]. She has an [[eyepatch]] over her right eye and has her left arm tied behind her back. In her [[Queen's Blade Unlimited]] [[Aldra_(queen's_blade_unlimited)|depiction]], she is significantly shorter and has [[green eyes]] instead.

[[Summoner Aldra]] in [[Queen's Blade Rebellion]] wears an [[apron]], [[purple panties]] and [[thighhighs]] and fights with a boat oar.

body:
A grenade launcher is a weapon that launches a [[grenade]] further and more accurately than a soldier could. There are those designed to be attached to long arms and those that are used as standalone weapons. Automatic grenade launchers also exist. These are usually crew-served or mounted on vehicles.

Despite the similarity in names, a grenade launcher is not the same as a [[rpg (weapon)|rocket propelled grenade]] launcher and they should not be tagged as such.

title: tree-topper
body:
From Wikipedia:

A tree-topper or treetopper is a decorative ornament placed on the top (or "crown") of a Christmas tree. Tree-toppers can take any form, though the most common include a star (representing the Star of Bethlehem), finial, angel ("Christmas angel"), or fairy. Additional forms range from a paper rosette, ribbon bow, Father Christmas or Santa Claus, to a Christian cross, owl, white dove, spike, or sunburst.

Tree-toppers may be made of from a wide range of materials. Modern plastic tree-toppers are often electric and once connected with the tree's lights offer a gentle glow. Following World War II, various symbols of Christmastide, such as Santa Claus, were introduced as electrified tree-toppers.

title: tiger_(p)
body:
The [b]Porsche Tiger[/b], also known as the [b]VK4501(P)[/b] or [b]Tiger(P)[/b], was an unsuccessful heavy tank prototype produced by Porsche in [[Germany]] during 1942.

On the 21st May 1942 Henschel and Porsche at a meeting in Germany were asked to submit designs for a 45 ton heavy tank capable of mounting the high velocity 88mm KwK L/56 gun which was derived from the German [[88_flak|88mm flak gun]]. Both the Henschel and Porsche tanks were to be fitted with the same turret supplied by Krupp. The Porsche company worked on updating the VK3001P medium tank, Porsche's medium tank prototype, and adapted parts used on it for the new tank.

The new Porsche tank, designated the VK4501(P) was to be powered by twin air cooled gasoline Porsche Type 101/1 engines which were mounted to the rear of the tank. The twin engines would then drive two generators, one on either side of the tank, which would then power two motors which would drive the tracks. But the engine along with its drive system were very prone to break down and needed almost constant maintenance to keep the tank running. This and the tank being less maneuverable than its competitor was the reason why Henschel's prototype, the [[Tiger I]], was adopted for production instead.

Porsche AG had already manufactured about one hundred chassis of the unsuccessful Porsche Tiger that were no longer required. It was therefore decided that the Porsche chassis were to be used as the basis of a new heavy tank destroyer (the [[Elefant]]), mounting Krupp's newly developed 88 mm Pak 43/2 anti-tank gun.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "VK4501":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VK4501
* GuP website: "Panzerkampfwagen VI 'Tiger (P)'":http://girls-und-panzer.jp/mecha_vk4501.html

title: uchuu_no_senshi
body:
[b][i]Starship Troopers[/i][/b] (宇宙の戦士 [i]Uchuu No Senshi[/i], lit. "Soldiers of Space") is a six part anime OVA produced by Sunrise/Bandai Visual and released in 1988. It is based on the book [[Starship Troopers]] by Robert A. Heinlein that was published in 1959. 

This anime production is considered by many the "most faithful" to the original novel's plot, despite the fact that many liberties were taken with the characters and the original book's themes. For instance [[Johnny Rico]], an [[Asian]] [[philippines|Filipino]] in the novel, is a [[blonde_hair|blonde]] White [[argentina|Argentine]] in the OVA. 

Interestingly, the main character's ethnicity in the OVA series has more in common with Paul Verhoeven's 1997 film than the source material — this despite their productions being wholly unrelated and having nearly a decade of difference. However, unlike the 1997 film, the most prominent link the anime has to the original book are the inclusion of [[power armor]] and drop pods that were absent in Verhoeven's film.

[[Miyatake Kazutaka]] of Studio Nue originally designed the [[power suit]]s in the OVA for the Japanese edition of the 50s novel in the early 80s. The design also appeared uncredited in the [[Daicon III]] and [[Daicon IV]] fan made animated shorts in the early 80s, several years before the OVA was made.

h4. See also

* [[Carmen Ibanez]]

title: pish
body:
A character from [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V]], known as [b]Peashy[/b] in English localizations.

[[Personification]] of the [[PC Engine]]. Is not very smart and tends to use (childish) violence on others. Grows very attached to [[Neptune (neptunia)|]] and [[Pururut]], whom she calls "Neptuna" ("Neputenu" in the Japanese version) and "Ploot" ("Pururuto" in the Japanese version).

[spoiler]During the course of the game, she comes in contact with a CPU memory and is turned into a CPU without any of the protagonists knowing. Eventually, [[Anonedeath]], one of the Seven Sages, learns of this and changes part of her memory in order to turn her into a tool of the Seven Sages. Using her CPU form [[Yellow Heart (neptunia)|]] and a technical booster built by Anonydeath, she becomes a major problem for the protagonists. (And a frustration. Take a look at her CPU-forms bust size and you will know why). Later on, she can become an ally however.[/spoiler]

Voiced by: [[Yuuki Aoi]] (Japanese), Sandy Fox (English, games), Tia Ballard (English, anime)

title: fumirul
body:
Fumiruiru is Kuon's handmaiden and childhood friend.

Born from an union between members of two rival clans, she was left behind as a baby until [[Ulthury]] took her and, as the clans end their grudge due to her existence, was bought back to her family. It was in this state that she debuted in the original [[Utawarerumono]], making her only somewhat older than Kuon.

In her adulthood, with her talents and Urtoriy's tutelage, Fumiruiru became a very proficient mage and healer. With her beauty and her other [[large breasts|"talents"]], she became known as a great beauty. With her clumsiness, her [[wardrobe malfunction]] tendencies and her obliviousness to this, she also became known as the "Lady of Destruction". It was in this state that she appeared in [[Utawarerumono: Futari no Hakuoro]] as a playable character.

In the western release of the games, she is refered as [b]Fumirul[/b], as to simplify the pronounciation of her name.

body:
俺の名を言ってみろ ([i]Ore no na wo itte miro.[/i])

A quote said by [[Jagi]] from [[Hokuto no Ken]] when he went up to a random stranger who was harassing a woman and opened his own jacket to reveal the fake seven scars on his chest. Jagi demanded the stranger to say his name or else he would blow his head off with a sawed-off shotgun. [spoiler]The shells ended up being duds and the stranger died from shock.[/spoiler]

Later this quote was adopted as Jagi's God Fist Blow in [[Hokuto no Ken Shinpan no Sousousei Kengo Retsuden]]. Jagi gives his opponent two multiple-choice questions. When his enemy makes a mistake twice, he inflicts heavy damage on the opponent.

title: m50_ontos
body:
The [b]M50[/b] [i][b]Ontos[/b][/i] (Greek for "thing") was an American light armored tracked anti-tank vehicle developed in the 1950s as a fast [[tank]] killer for airborne forces.

It mounted six M40 106 mm [[rocket launcher]]s as its main armament, which could be fired in rapid succession against single targets to guarantee a kill. 

The M50 was produced in limited numbers for the U.S. Marines after the U.S. Army lost interest in the project. 

The [[Marine Corps]] consistently reported excellent results when they used the Ontos for direct fire support against enemy infantry in numerous battles and operations during the [[Vietnam War]]. 

The appearance of the M50 Ontos was sometimes enough to make the Vietnamese forces break and run, and anecdotal accounts describe these enemies fleeing occupied buildings when a single spotting round fired from the M50 entered a window.

The American stock of Ontos was largely expended towards the end of the conflict and the remaining vehicles were finally removed from active service in 1969.

The Ontos inspired the design of the [[Monster Destroid]] [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] science fiction series from the 1980s. 

H4.External links

* "Wikipedia: M50 Ontos":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M50_Ontos

title: bloodstained:_ritual_of_the_night
body:
[b]Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night[/b] is a exploration action-platform video game developed by former [[Castlevania (series)|]] series producer Koji Igarashi, ArtPlay, and DICO for Microsoft Windows, OS X, Linux, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch and Playstation Vita. The Switch and Vita versions are being developed by Armature Studio. The game is a spiritual successor to the Castlevania series.

Inti Creates were initially part of the game's development until they split from the team midway through development, however, as part of a stretch goal for the main game, they have also developed a retro-inspired spin-off title (originally planned as a prequel to the main game) in the form of [[Bloodstained: Curse of the Moon]].

A second style of whip are those that are a firm stick and lack a lash.  For tagging purposes these images should be tagged [[riding crop]] instead.

The distinct loud sound of a whip "cracking" as it is swung is produced by a part of the lash breaking the sound barrier and generating a small sonic boom.

The whip is a signature [[weapon]] of the [[castlevania (series)|Belmont]] (JP: [i]Belmondo[/i]) clan.

title: grolla_seyfarth
body:
Grolla is a young woman from [[Rosenkreuzstilette]] who is easily noticeable for wearing armor as well as a white headband and a torn cloth around her legs and carrying an oversized sword to fight with, known as the Demon Sword Grollschwert, whose strength and power intensifies when its user gets weaker, and can release shockwaves. She is always calm and collected, shows loyalty to her colleagues while being guarded to everyone else, and is every bit as strict with others as she is with herself. However, if crossed in any way, she will stop at nothing to exact her revenge. She does not like sharing her thoughts with others, not even her friends. However, she is good friends with [[Sichte_Meister|Sichte Meister]], whom she holds the most dearly to. She often speaks in an old [[knight]] fashion and prefers to let her Grollschwert do the talking - in simple words, fighting first and asking questions later. She is the current posessor of Grollschwert, the previous being her grandfather.

She gets her own side game in the original game called Rosenkreuzstilette Grollschwert, where she plays a lot like [[Zero (mega man)|Zero]] from the [[Mega Man X (series)|]] and [[Mega Man Zero (series)|]] games. Her grandfather was a legendary war hero named [[Raimund Seyfarth]], who was known as Thanatos in his living days and, unbeknownst to her until she meets him at Graf Michael Sepperin's castle bridge in Grollschwert, was recently resurrected by Sepperin as a wraith resembling the [[grim_reaper|Grim Reaper]] (can also resemble [[death_(castlevania)|Death]] from [[Castlevania (series)|]]) and hired to guard the bridge. Ever since the events of the original game, she has taken up Raimund's Grollschwert to use later on, despite the fact that Raimund's spirit seems to be posessing it - therefore it seems to lead him to posess his own granddaughter every time she wields it.

title: brand_of_the_exalt
body:
In [[Fire Emblem Awakening]], a symbol which appears somewhere on the body of each member of the royal family of Ylisse. Also called the Mark of Naga.

Example: post #1204053 (on Chrom's shoulder, in Lucina's eye).

Characters who canonically bear the Brand of the Exalt include:
* [[Chrom (fire emblem)|]] (right shoulder)
* [[Lucina (fire emblem)|]] (left eye)
* [[Emmeryn (fire emblem)|]] (forehead)
* [[Owain (fire emblem)|]] (arm)
* [[Ophelia (fire emblem)|]] (arm)
* [[Inigo (fire emblem)|]] (right eye) - only if he is Chrom's son

Notably, [[Lissa (fire emblem)|]] is the only member of the family without the Brand.

title: rumbling_(shingeki_no_kyojin)
body:
The Rumbling ([i]Jinarashi[/i], 地均し) is a catastrophic event in [[Shingeki no Kyojin]].

[spoiler]It involves the unhardening of all the walls of Paradis Island and the unleashing of all of the [[Colossal Titan|Colossal Titans]] that are buried within them to rampage all across the world, an act that can only be done with the power of the [[Founding Titan]]. When [[Eren Yeager]] takes on the power of the Founding Titan, he sets this event in motion in a bid to destroy all of humanity outside Paradis.[/spoiler]

title: shirt_pull
body:
When the collar of a [[shirt]] has been pulled down, usually to expose the [[breasts]].

Not to be confused with [[shirt lift]] (lifting up the bottom of a shirt to expose the chest) or [[shirt tug]] (tugging down the bottom of a shirt to cover the crotch).

Also, not to be confused with [[collar tug]] which is for when a character pulls out on the collar of their shirt merely to let fresh air in or to show nervousness, although if it results in the exposure of the breasts or cleavage, it should be tagged as both.

h4. See also

Delusions are powerful, [[vision_(genshin_impact)|Vision-like]] objects produced by the Fatui. Like Visions, Delusions grant their wielders the ability to manipulate certain elements, although their power is said to exceed those of Visions, enough that they are said to make Visions look like "child's play." An item in [[Genshin Impact]].

These [[fake wings|artificial wings]] can be attached to one's back and be used to glide through the sky after jumping from a high place or finding an updraft. Do not use the tag [[glider]] for wind gliders, as it implies [[aircraft]].

title: cordless_phone
body:
A cordless phone, also known as a portable telephone, is a landline [[phone|telephone]] with a portable battery powered handset, which are larger than a [[cellphone]].  The handset connects wirelessly to a radio base station that is directly connected to the landline.  Cordless phones are charged either in small charging cradles (ex: post #1834655) or a larger base station (ex: post #1420950).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Cordless telephone":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cordless_telephone]

title: hornet-chan_(carriercon)
body:
A [[personification]] of the [[USS Hornet (CV-12)]]. She is a mascot for CarrierCon, an anime, game, geek and cosplay [[convention]] held on the real life ship, which is currently a museum ship in Alameda, California just outside Oakland in the San Francisco Bay Area.

Illustrated by [[Meatbun 33]] ahead of the 2023 edition. That year, the convention collaborated with [i][[Azur Lane]][/i], where Hornet (CV-12) appears as [[Hornet II (Azur Lane)|]], and the ship was also chosen as the venue for [i]AL[/i]'s live English/Worldwide 5th Anniversary event. She also appeared as a [[virtual YouTuber]] as part of the VFleet Project, which originated from the Hornet Museum before becoming its own entity.

h4. External links
* "Twitter (via CarrierCon)":[https://twitter.com/CarrierConBA]

title: zanscare
body:
[b]The Zanscare Empire[/b] is the main antagonist faction from [[Victory Gundam]]. They are a matriarchal [[space]] empire that has set out to conquer the Earth after the [[Earth Federation]] stagnated in the late U.C. period. 

They are known for their brutal tactics such as carpet bombing cities and performing public executions of dissenters via [[guillotine]]. Their [[mecha|mobile suits]] all have [[bug]] motifs. Their [[military uniform]]s are similar to the old models used by [[Zeon]]/[[Neo Zeon]] and also based and inspired by the [[Wehrmacht]] uniforms from [[World War II]].

title: denver_nuggets
body:
A professional [[basketball]] team based in Denver, Colorado, [[United States]]. They compete in the [[National Basketball Association]] (NBA) as a member of the league's Western Conference Northwest Division. 

The team was founded as the Denver Larks in 1967 as a charter franchise of the American Basketball Association (ABA), but changed its name to the Denver Nuggets after just one season. When they won their first NBA championship in 2023, no NBA franchise had waited longer in terms of seasons played before winning their first title.

The Nuggets' current uniform colors are navy blue, powder blue, sunshine yellow, and white. The team's primary color is navy blue, while powder blue and sunshine yellow are used as accent colors.

H4. Players (referred to in art)
* [[Nikola Jokic]]
* [[Jamal Murray]]

h4. External links
* "Official Website (via NBA.com)":[https://www.nba.com/nuggets/]
* "Wikipedia: Denver Nuggets":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denver_Nuggets]
* "Wikipedia: National Basketball Association (NBA)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Basketball_Association]

title: seisenshi_dunbine
body:
[b]Seisenshi Dunbine[/b] ([i]Sacred Warrior Dunbine[/i]), also known as [b]Aura Battler Dunbine[/b], is a [[mecha]] anime television series created by  [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] and produced by Sunrise Studios in 1983. It also had mecha designs by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]]. 

The series is notable because it was one of the first anime mecha shows that combined medieval [[fantasy]] with [[science fiction]] [[super robot]] and real [[robot]] concepts.

The series would later inspire several OVAs, listed below
* [b][[Seisenshi Dunbine: New Story of Aura Battler Dunbine]][/b] - a sequel set in the distant future of the original series' world.
* [b][[Rean no Tsubasa]][/b] - a standalone ONA set in a separate continuity, but featuring similar setting elements. This ONA is an adaptation of Tomino's 80s novel series of the same name, which itself is an alternate Byston Well story to Dunbine.
* [b]Byston Well Monogatari: Garzey no Tsubasa[/b] - a 3-episode non-mecha fantasy OVA released in 1996, notorious for it's comically bad English dub. Also known as [b]Garzey's Wing[/b].

h4. Some mecha from the series
* [[Dunbine]]

title: pot_of_greed
body:
[quote]Pot of Greed? What does it do?![/quote]

A spell card from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] which allows a duelist to draw two cards, due to this potentially game-changing effect, Pot of Greed is forbidden/banned in official competitive play, and has been since [[2005]].

Also became a recurring meme in the YGO community due to how anyone who use this card in anime will [b]always[/b] explain the effect of the card every time they use it. Even within the same episode.

title: yuda_(hokuto_no_ken)
body:
[b]Yuda[/b] ([b]ユダ[/b] - also spelled as [b]Juda[/b]) is one of the antagonist from [[Hokuto no Ken]]

Yuda is the successor of Nanto Kokaku Ken (南斗紅鶴拳, "South Star Crimson Crane Fist"), a style specializing in long range attacks. Representing the Star of Enchantment (妖星, Yosei), also known as the Star of Betrayal (裏切りの星, Uragiri no Hoshi), Yuda declares himself to be the strongest and most beautiful of fighters, and is willing to betray his own subordinates for his own self-gain.

Yuda is notable for being one of the first character in Japanese anime history (at least implied) to be a non-binary (more specifically a queer), as he proclaims himself to be "more beautiful than any women" while also having his own harem. [spoiler]In addition, before he died, Yuda admitted that he secretly admires Rei both as a person and a martial artist.[/spoiler]

h4. Known Moves

* 伝衝裂波 ([i]Densho Reppa[/i])
** A slicing air pressure attack used by Yuda. The effect is such that the ground is split as the attack moves towards the target.

* 血粧嘴 ([i]Kessho Shi[/i])
** The ultimate Nanto Kokaku Ken attack. A [[m. bison|psycho crusher]]-style human torpedo attack.

* 南斗鷹爪破斬 ([i]Nanto Yoso Hazan[/i])
** A technique that cuts a target opponent in half, vertically.

title: shackles
body:
For tagging purposes this tag refers to metal [[cuffs]] used for restraint of the arms or legs, typically used in a dungeon or prison type setting when not used as an accessory. They're similar to the cuffs used under the [[handcuffs]] tag, but are depicted more solid, wider, and frequently depicted as simply a solid band of metal around the leg or arm.  They may be attached to something else, such as a wall or a [[ball and chain restraint]]. [[Oni]] are typically seen wearing shackles.

For non-metal cuffs used for the same purpose, simply use just the [[cuffs]] tag instead. The word shackles carries undertones of being locked in a dungeon or a dark room.

h4. See also

* [[Pillory]]
* [[Stocks]]
* [[Metal collar]]

title: 2023_china_balloon_incident
body:
In late January 2023, a high-altitude balloon of Chinese origin drifted across North America, causing a major diplomatic incident between the [[United States]] and People's Republic of [[China]].

The balloon was shot down by a US Air Force [[F-22 Raptor]] over territorial waters near South Carolina on February 4, 2023.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: 2023 Chinese balloon incident":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Chinese_balloon_incident

title: euro_2020
body:
The [b]2020 UEFA European Football Championship[/b], an international [[soccer]] championship held every four years by various men's national teams across Europe.

Unlike previous years where one or two countries play host, matches in this edition were held across 11 countries, culminating in the final at Wembley Stadium in London.

It was supposed to be held in the middle of 2020, but concerns arising from the [[coronavirus pandemic]] forced organizers to postpone the competition to mid-2021, although the short name was still kept despite change in dates.

[[Italy]] won the title by beating [[England]] in a penalty shootout 3-2 after a 1-1 draw after extra time.

title: gluck_(sousou_no_frieren)
body: Glück is the Feudal lord of the Fortified City of Weise. He is the father of [[lekture (sousou no frieren)|Lektüre]] and thus the father-in-law of [[Denken (sousou no frieren)|]]. He made a deal with [[Macht (sousou no frieren)|]] about a hundred years ago to set up an experiment to help him understand humans and had Macht serve him as the family's mage.

title: macht_(sousou_no_frieren)
body: Macht, also known as Macht of El Dorado, is one of the Seven Sages of Destruction and considered the most dangerous one of them. He made a deal with [[gluck (sousou no frieren)|Glück]] about a hundred years ago to set up an experiment to understand humans and started to serve him as the family's mage. He was also [[Denken (sousou no frieren)|]]'s childhood mentor under Glück's order.

title: yabai
body:
A [[Futaba Channel]] character, one of the [[Nijiura Maids]].

She's a harpy maid based on the cursed snowy owl from the manga [[Jagan wa Gachirin ni Tobu]], which became very popular on the futaba guro board when a user posted a select few panels from it.

title: denken_(sousou_no_frieren)
body:
Denken is an Imperial Mage and a First Class Mage.

Denken is an [[old man|elderly man]] who has [[brown hair]] and a [[long beard|long, thick beard]]. He wears a [[monocle]] on his left eye. He is commonly seen wearing a long, [[black robe]] with [[white collar|white collars]].
